item.title: Bicycle Friendly State Report Card - League of American Bicyclists
item.description: Every year the League of American Bicyclists issues each state a “Bicycle Friendly State” report card based on over 100 data points with input from state agencies and advocates. The 2019 report shows that out of 50 states, New Hampshire has slid down to a 36th place ranking and Maine to a 20th place ranking. No surprise that both states earned a “D” in infrastructure and funding. Join SABR’s advocacy committee by contacting Andy@seacoastbikes.

item.title: NEW BIKE/PED PATH ACROSS LITTLE BAY IS OPEN!
item.description: The new path provides a safe route for bicycles and pedestrians across Little Bay, between Dover and Newington/Portsmouth. This temporary Bike/Pedestrian pathway was constructed in response to many years of advocacy by SABR members to maintain bike/ped access during the reconstruction of the General Sullivan Bridge. NHDOT originally proposed a shuttle service, which SABR vehemently opposed. The emergency closure of the General Sullivan Bridge in September of 2018 necessitated NHDOT to develop a solution sooner than anticipated.
